answers.answer: Hi, how old are you and do you have history of diabetes or hypertension? Conditions like orthostatic hypotension, atherosclerosis of carotid arteries, heart diseases like arrythmias, hypovolumia, anemia, hypoglycemia etc can cause lightheadedness.Please get yourself investigated for these conditions, Blood electrolyte levels, hemoglobin etc should be undertaken, also it is important to rule out autonomic neuropathy.
I had this also I was diagnosed with vertigo check into this it has an easy fix you may need some physical therapy but it is fairly easy to get rid of.
